alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:22AM EST until December 18 at 4:27PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Red Clay Creek At Wooddale affecting New Castle County. For the Red Clay Creek...including Wooddale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Clay Creek at Wooddale. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flooding begins in adjacent open fields. At 7.5 feet, Barley Mill Road begins to flood. Brandywine Springs Park floods. At 8.5 feet, Flooding begins near Old Capital Trail and Newport Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Monday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.4 feet on 03/28/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (5 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Red Clay Creek Wooddale 7.0 8.2 Mon 4 am 2.7 MSG 8.3 6am 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
